Jeremy Fourna
Product Manager

Westwing November 2016 to July 2017

My title there was Product Manager. Westwing is based in Munich ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª but I worked in their Berlin ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª office.

Click here to know more about Westwing

Why I joined Westwing

My wife and I wanted to leave Paris ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· to get a bigger appartment.
I checked the offers in various cities, in France, London ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ and Berlin ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª.

I was really excited by the opportunity to work for Westing in their logistic division and mostly for they warehouse management system.
Plus living in Berlin ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª will be a huge plus.

What are my responsabilites at Westwing

I was in charge of the warehouse management system used most of Westwing warehouses. This software was inherited from Rocket Internet, then it was forked to match Westwing requirements.

Features & Projects I worked on

Multiple warehouse support

Originally, the warehouse management system could only support 1 warehouse. All the orders that entered the system could only fulfilled by 1 warehouse. This implied that an external system will dispatch the orders to each warehouse management system.

With this improvement, you can have mutiple warehouses being managed by a single warehouse management system.

Cost reduction and user productivity

We have dozens of workers inside our warehouses. Based on the data we collected, we could see which flows inside the warehouses were slow and needed some improvements. The improvements we were looking at were mostly refactoring existing features to remove all the useless steps or increase the performance of the software to allow the users to be faster in their tasks.

Travelling time of a picker

Our warehouses had multiple floors, so when you need to define a picking route for a picker, you must have the best heuristic algorithms to make their route as efficient as possible.

I created a prototype to reduce the picking time by 20%, mostly inspired by the knot theory and the travelling salesman problem.

Work methods

My team consisted of 6 developers. We worked in Scrum mode with a sprint every week.

I worked in full english (read/speak/write) with a multi-cultural team ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡° ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ ğŸ‡­ğŸ‡º ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡°.

Why I left Westwing

To prepare Westwing stock market introduction, the company needed to reduce its costs, they decided to close the Berlin ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª office and bring back to Munich ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª some people from the Berlin office. I was fortuned to be part of this group of people. I turned the opportunity down because I just moved in Berlin 6 months ago and I did not want to move again to another city.

Personal projects

Work related

When I work for a company, at some point the business model or the problems that we uncounter give me inspiration for fun side projects.

Product Management game
Started at Spryker

This idea was born during our first product managers offsite in November 2018.
We were playing a product management card game but we were disappointed by the game quality, and we started mostly with Simon Brugger to imagine a better game targeted for product managers.

GADM GeoJSON
Started at Seven Senders

With the library Mapshaper and Leaflet I wanted to build a tool that will concatenate all the shapefiles for a country and display them on a map. When you zoom in/out the administrative areas are loaded and displayed so that you get more details on the map.

ğŸ’» Github repository

Warehouse layout
Started at Westwing

Quicky build your warehouse layout with your aisles and racks.

Warehouse path
Started at Westwing

Provide heuristics algorithms to define a best picker tour when picking orders in a warehouse. Use Warehouse layout to display the picker route.

Better data table
Started at Westwing

I have been inspired by this article called Design better data tables. I tried to reproduce those best practices on a small JS library.

About Basket-Ball ğŸ€
I have started 3 projects along the years that touch each an area of Basket-Ball.
Basket Ball live stats

I played Basket-Ball between 8 and 18 years old, at youth high level in France. Taking the game statistics was left to the assistant coach and parents that knew how to take the. You needed to wait for the end of the game to know how well you played or how many turnovers your teams did in the game.

I build a small app that allow anyone to take the statistics of a Basket-Ball game and share them in real time with the world. That way you do not need to wait for the end of the game to know how well your child did in the game or if your favorite local team is doing in their game when they play outside.

ğŸ’» Github repository

Basket Ball simulation game

This is an attempt to build a Basket-Ball simulation game.

ğŸ’» Github repository

Basket Ball strategy

When a coach shared with us the game strategies and plays we will play in game, she/he used paper or whiteboard with step by step instructions and later real life repetitions on the court. You could only learn and train them during the practices.

I wanted to build a tool for coach and players to share the strategies and plays, be able to see them in motion to understand faster how the play will be played.

ğŸ’» Github repository

Mangatek ğŸ“š

I probably own more than 300 mangas volumes. I read and buy more than 10 mangas at any given time. The problem when you enter the library is to remember at which volume you are currently!

With this app, you can define for any mangas, which volume you own, so that in one glance you see which volume you should buy next.
